'Twas close by a murm'ring rill,</br>Where waters meander'd along,</br>I plac'd me beneath a green hill,</br>To listen to Daphne's sweet song.
No music so gladden'd my ear,</br>Nor e'er did my heart so delight,</br>I wish'd ev'ry moment a year,</br>And morning might never be night.
The lambkins did gambol and play,</br>Delighted and pleas'd with her song;</br>No shepherdess e'er look'd so gay,</br>She's beautiful, charming, and young.
As soon as sweet Daphne gave o'er</br>Her pleasing melodious strain,</br>I did the fair damsel implore</br>To ease my fond heart of its pain.
I said my lov'd Daphne be kind,</br>And grant a fond swain his request;</br>Oh!  cast not his sighs to the wind,</br>He loves you — and begs to be blest.
Then thus the fair damsel reply'd,</br>(So pleasing and sweet was her voice)</br>"No shepherd I ever espy'd</br>So kind, nor so worthy my choice."
With joy then to Daphne I said,</br>"Since you are so loving and kind,</br>A garland I'll weave for your head</br>Of roses and lilies entwin'd."
As soon as the garland I'd wove,</br>And given it unto the maid,</br>We instantly quitted the grove,</br>Where woodbines and amaranths shade.
Then thus I address'd my lov'd fair,</br>(Such innocence dwelt on her mind)</br>"Haste, haste, let's to Hymen repair,</br>That our hearts may be speedily join'd."
Then Daphne consented with joy,</br>And with speed we skip'd over the lawn,</br>No wishes my heart did annoy,</br>But a hasty return of the dawn.
Haste, fly ye swift minutes away,</br>On wings make bright Phoebus appear,</br>With lustre to brighten the day,</br>That I'm to be blest with my dear.
The morning appear'd — and the green</br>Enamel'd with flow'rets gay,</br>The birds to enliven the scene,</br>Did warble on every spray.
Now every sorrow is gone,</br>And the moments of pleasure are nigh,</br>And I and my Daphne are one,</br>My Daphne, whom none can outvie.
Now wistfully do I relate</br>My sentiments free from my mind,</br>That every shepherd's fond mate,</br>Like Colin's, prove loving and kind.
How pleasant my time steals away,</br>Nor moment's nor years do seem long,</br>With pleasure I pass the whole day,</br>Delighted with Daphne's sweet song.</br>
